summary: Lee Strickland is mentioned in several memoranda related to the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) meetings and discussions concerning the release of CIA records pertaining to the JFK assassination. The documents suggest Strickland was involved in discussions regarding sensitive CIA information, including the identification of the Warrenton Training Center (WTC) as a CIA facility, the release of information on CIA employees under State cover, the opening date of the Nosenko NBR material, and the handling of Cuban Revolutionary Council (CRC) financial records. Strickland appears to have been involved in addressing the ARRB's requests and concerns regarding the declassification and release of these records.
significance: Lee Strickland's significance in the JFK context lies in their involvement with the CIA's response to the ARRB's requests for declassification and release of sensitive information related to the assassination. Their role appears to be related to managing the release of information while protecting national security interests and CIA operational details.
